channel.title: Re-Enable xp drops - Still need this!
channel.description: I'm not sure where to look or what to do here, can someone please help my xp drops are not showing up, everything is coded as needed what do i do to re enable these xp drops

item.title: Re-Enable xp drops - Still need this!
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:38, topic:551486”][quote author=tank nation link=topic=670401.msg4482952#msg4482952 date=1431486829]

From what I know, that would mean that you have sprites named "XP " and a number after it in your cache. Specifically, the root of the sprite folder.
So.
Cache_path/your_cache_name/Sprites/XP a_number_here
(Usually.)
Make sure there are sprites there with that kind of name. if not… that is why they are not showing up.

Yes but see this client wasnt really made for the xp counter to be there it was made to be like runescape 2007 client or better known orion client take a look.

If this is in the cache folder with my sprites ect… then no there is nothing there with XP
[/quote]
Then that would be why you cannot see the sprites…
So you need to find the sprites, either from another cache or from searching on the internet.[/quote]

Read full topic
item.source: Re-Enable xp drops - Still need this!

From what I know, that would mean that you have sprites named "XP " and a number after it in your cache. Specifically, the root of the sprite folder.
So.
Cache_path/your_cache_name/Sprites/XP a_number_here
(Usually.)
Make sure there are sprites there with that kind of name. if not… that is why they are not showing up.
[/quote]

If this is in the cache folder with my sprites ect… then no there is nothing there with XP[/quote]
Then that would be why you cannot see the sprites…
So you need to find the sprites, either from another cache or from searching on the internet.

Read full topic

item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:34, topic:551486”]Again… It would have the key words “new Sprite”.
That is not it, that is your client’s default settings…
The loading method is “startUp”. It would be in there… Or within a method that is executed in there.[/quote]

Okay this is the only other thing i see, [code]for(int i = 0; i < 3; i++)
counter[i] = new Sprite("XP "+i);
for (int l4 = 0; l4 < 10; l4++)
modIcons[l4] = new Sprite(streamLoader_2, “mod_icons”, l4);

		Sprite sprite = new Sprite(streamLoader_2, "screenframe", 0);
		leftFrame = new RSImageProducer(sprite.myWidth, sprite.myHeight,
				getGameComponent());[/code]

Again, I would like to see where the sprites for the counter array are loaded.[/quote]

Okay so i got the xp counter to appear, well kinda… take a look. and i think this is where your talking about the sprites for the counter array.

private void drawCounterOnScreen() { int x = 520; int y = 47; counter[2].drawSprite(x-100, y+8); int i = aTextDrawingArea_1271.getTextWidth(Integer.toString(xpCounter)); aTextDrawingArea_1271.drawText(0xffffff, "XP:", y+21, x-88); aTextDrawingArea_1271.drawText(0xffffff, Integer.toString(xpCounter), y+21, x-12-i); if (expAdded == 0) { i = smallText.getTextWidth(Integer.toString(expAdded)+"xp"); smallText.drawText(0xff9933, Integer.toString(expAdded)+"xp", y+21+18+xpAddedPos, x-12-i); xpAddedPos += 2; if (xpAddedPos >= 50) { xpAddedPos = 0; expAdded = 0; } } }

item.title: Re-Enable xp drops - Still need this!
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:24, topic:551486”]You are seriously just ignoring my words now dude.

You don’t see any code that sets to to “true” because of how the person wrote the code.

counterOn = !counterOn;
Right here is what I’m talking about.
This code basically says: set counterOn to the opposite of it’s current value.
So if it’s true, then it gets set false. If it’s false, then it gets set true.

Another question. Where is the array “counter” loading it’s sprites from? If at all.

The array I’m talking about is in your code you’ve provided. If you’d take half a second to look at it you would see it.

	counter[(counterOn || (x1 >= 520 && x1 <= 554 && y1 >= 47 && y1 <= 81) ? 1 : 0)].drawSprite(x, y);

^See the red text.
That’s the “array thing” I’m talking about.[/quote]

No, i understood what you were talking about the counter and counteron just didnt know how i can set these to true or false, do i need to make a code for it or what?

Read full topic

item.title: Re-Enable xp drops - Still need this!
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:16, topic:551486”]Those are just the variable declarations, not exactly what we need to look at.
We need to see the code that would draw the xp counter.

There will be code like this (may not be this exactly) near what I’m talking about… You will be able to find it by searching for one of the variables…

xpFlag.drawSprite(423, flagPos);[/quote]

These ones stood out to me the most , and are basically the only thing to have “drawsprite” near them [code]private void processXPCounterClick() {
int x = super.mouseX;
int y = super.mouseY;
if (x >= 520 && x <= 554 && y >= 47 && y <= 81 && clientSize == 0) {
menuActionName[3] = counterOn ? “Off” : “On”;
menuActionID[3] = 474;
menuActionName[2] = “Reset”;
menuActionID[2] = 475;
menuActionName[1] = xpLock ? “Unlock XP” : “Lock XP”;
menuActionID[1] = 476;
menuActionRow = 4;
}
}
private void drawXPCounter() {
int x = 1;
int y = 47;
int x1 = super.mouseX;
int y1 = super.mouseY;
counter[(counterOn || (x1 >= 520 && x1 <= 554 && y1 >= 47 && y1 <= 81) ? 1 : 0)].drawSprite(x, y);
}

private void drawCounterOnScreen() {
int x = 520;
int y = 47;
counter[2].drawSprite(x-100, y+8);
int i = aTextDrawingArea_1271.getTextWidth(Integer.toString(xpCounter));
aTextDrawingArea_1271.drawText(0xffffff, “XP:”, y+21, x-88);
aTextDrawingArea_1271.drawText(0xffffff, Integer.toString(xpCounter), y+21, x-12-i);
if (expAdded == 0) {[/code]

Read full topic

&& super.mouseY < 503)
